page.title: 02GENERAL SURVEY continued
page.content: GENERAL SURVEY continued nearby towns or who commute into London every day. Similarly the population of the villages on the fringe of the area are a mixture of people who have lived there a long time and work locally, and people who have bought houses quite recently and who work outside the local community. The villages and farms in the area are generally too small and too scattered to have much community life of their own, and the social life of the population tends to gravitate towards the surrounding towns of Tring, Aylesbury, Chesham and Berkhamsted.
